question: [File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-crypto/benches/ark_rand.rs] [Function: bench_sample_field_element_generic()] [Weak RNG] Does using thread_rng() without explicit seeding in benchmarks mask potential determinism vulnerabilities in sample_field_element that could allow attackers to predict field elements in DKG ceremonies? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-crypto/benches/ark_rand.rs] [Function: bench_sample_field_element_generic()] [Benchmark methodology] Could the comment 'results are similar for e.g. rand::rngs::StdRng::seed_from_u64(42)' indicate that benchmarks with deterministic seeding fail to reveal timing side-channels exploitable by Byzantine validators? (High)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-crypto/benches/ark_rand.rs] [Function: bench_scalar_from_uniform_be_bytes_generic()] [RNG state] Does the benchmark reuse the same RNG instance across iterations, potentially failing to detect state-dependent vulnerabilities in scalar_from_uniform_be_bytes that could compromise distributed key generation? (High)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-crypto/benches/ark_rand.rs] [Function: bench_sample_field_element_generic()] [Timing attack] Does the benchmark measure worst-case rejection sampling iterations for sample_field_element, or could high rejection rates leak information about field modulus boundaries during consensus key generation? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-crypto/benches/ark_rand.rs] [Function: bench_sample_field_element_generic()] [Side-channel leakage] Are the benchmarks run in constant-time mode, or do variable execution times in sample_field_element create timing oracles that Byzantine validators could exploit to extract secret shares? (High)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-crypto/benches/ark_rand.rs] [Function: bench_scalar_from_uniform_be_bytes_generic()] [Cache timing] Does the benchmark account for cache-timing differences in scalar_from_uniform_be_bytes modular reduction that could leak validator private keys during signature generation? (High)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-crypto/benches/ark_rand.rs] [Function: criterion_benchmark()] [Curve selection] Does benchmarking only BN254 and BLS12-381 curves mask vulnerabilities in the generic field sampling that could affect other curves if added to consensus in governance upgrades? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-crypto/benches/ark_rand.rs] [Function: criterion_benchmark()] [Field boundary] Could the benchmark fail to detect when sample_field_element generates biased field elements near modulus boundaries in BN254, compromising zero-knowledge proofs in keyless accounts? (High)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-crypto/benches/ark_rand.rs] [Function: criterion_benchmark()] [BLS12-381 specific] Does the benchmark verify that BLS12-381::Fr sampling produces uniform distribution required for consensus signature security, or could bias allow signature forgery? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-crypto/benches/ark_rand.rs] [Function: criterion_benchmark()] [BN254 specific] For BN254::Fr used in keyless Groth16 proofs, does the benchmark ensure sampling uniformity to prevent proof malleability attacks stealing user funds? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-crypto/benches/ark_rand.rs] [Function: bench_sample_field_element_generic()] [Edge cases] Does the benchmark test rejection sampling behavior when RNG returns maximum values, which could cause infinite loops in sample_field_element during validator key generation ceremonies? (High)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-crypto/benches/ark_rand.rs] [Function: bench_scalar_from_uniform_be_bytes_generic()] [Modular reduction] Does the benchmark verify correctness of from_le_bytes_mod_order in scalar_from_uniform_be_bytes, or could incorrect reduction allow invalid signatures in consensus? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-crypto/benches/ark_rand.rs] [Function: bench_sample_field_element_generic()] [Memory safety] Does the benchmark detect potential memory allocation failures in vec![0u8; num_bytes] within sample_field_element that could crash validators during epoch transitions? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-crypto/benches/ark_rand.rs] [Function: bench_scalar_from_uniform_be_bytes_generic()] [Double allocation] Does the benchmark catch performance regressions from double-sized byte allocation in scalar_from_uniform_be_bytes that could enable DoS attacks on validator key generation? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-crypto/benches/ark_rand.rs] [Function: bench_sample_field_element_generic()] [Distribution bias] Does the benchmark include statistical tests for uniformity of sample_field_element output, or could subtle bias enable Byzantine validators to predict DKG outcomes? (High)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-crypto/benches/ark_rand.rs] [Function: bench_scalar_from_uniform_be_bytes_generic()] [Modulo bias] Does the benchmark verify that scalar_from_uniform_be_bytes produces truly uniform scalars, or could modulo bias compromise BLS signature aggregation security? (High)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-crypto/benches/ark_rand.rs] [Function: criterion_benchmark()] [Performance optimization] Could the ~10x performance advantage of sample_field_element over scalar_from_uniform_be_bytes incentivize unsafe usage patterns that introduce timing vulnerabilities in consensus? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-crypto/benches/ark_rand.rs] [Function: bench_sample_field_element_generic()] [Rejection rate] Does the benchmark measure and alert on high rejection rates in sample_field_element that could cause timeouts during distributed key generation ceremonies? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-crypto/benches/ark_rand.rs] [Function: bench_sample_field_element_generic()] [Thread safety] Does using thread_rng() in the benchmark reveal thread-safety issues in sample_field_element when called concurrently by multiple validators during parallel transaction execution? (High)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-crypto/benches/ark_rand.rs] [Function: bench_scalar_from_uniform_be_bytes_generic()] [RNG contention] Could concurrent access to thread_rng() in benchmarks mask lock contention in scalar_from_uniform_be_bytes that degrades validator performance during high-load consensus rounds? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-crypto/benches/ark_rand.rs] [Overall] [Production parity] Do the benchmarks use the same RNG types and configurations as production DKG, or could differences hide vulnerabilities that only manifest during actual validator key generation? (High)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-crypto/benches/ark_rand.rs] [Overall] [Security assumptions] Does the benchmark documentation clarify security assumptions about RNG quality, or could developers misuse sample_field_element with weak PRNGs in validator implementations? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-crypto/benches/ark_rand.rs] [Function: bench_sample_field_element_generic()] [Generic parameter] Could the generic PrimeField parameter F allow instantiation with untested fields that bypass security properties validated only for BN254 and BLS12-381? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-crypto/benches/ark_rand.rs] [Function: bench_scalar_from_uniform_be_bytes_generic()] [Byte order] Does the benchmark verify that BE (big-endian) in the function name but LE (little-endian) in implementation doesn't cause endianness confusion leading to incorrect key material? (High)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-crypto/benches/ark_rand.rs] [Function: criterion_benchmark()] [Fr field properties] Does the benchmark validate that sampled Fr scalars satisfy the field order for BLS12-381 consensus signatures, or could invalid scalars cause signature verification failures? (Critical)
